title: Transparency Protocol Gambit
outcome: The Council launches the 'Transparency Protocol,' broadcasting BCI algorithms and sanitized debates. Citizens initially embrace the opening, but quickly realize the data is compromised. Frustration evolves into subtle, decentralized acts of noncompliance, undermining both BCI authority and the Council’s legitimacy.

events.description: The Council unveils the 'Transparency Protocol,' broadcasting BCI code and leadership meetings for public review. Many citizens cheer apparent openness.
Citizen activists highlight gaps in the released data, sparking online debates and crowdsourced audits. Commentators note evasive edits and redacted content.
Rumors spread that actual Council decisions still happen off-camera. Activist groups coordinate to test system weaknesses through orchestrated noncompliance.
Council members argue internally over mounting public distrust. Innovators push for deeper algorithmic openness, while Directorate members demand increased surveillance on the most vocal citizens.
Subtle mass acts of rule-bending and digital sabotage disrupt BCI predictions. The system’s influence visibly wanes as citizens reclaim small freedoms.
